body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
agst } Affidavits
Chas. Rodgers & Jno. W. Buckman

John Kitts of the Firm of Kitts & Werne doing business in the City of Louisville County of Jefferson and state of Kentucky States that on the 14th day of January 1863, one Chas Rodgers and one John W. Buckman feloniously stole took and carried away Twenty one Diamonds Stone: of the value of Twenty Seven hundred dollars: of the Gooods and Chattels of John Kitts and Joseph Werne doing business as aforesaid under the Style and firm of Kitts & Werne: Affiant says that said parties names are unknown to him but that they are now Fugitives from Justice from the State of Kentucky: and as he is informed and believes are in the state of Missouri: arrested, and awaiting a requisition from the Gov of Kentucky:
Subscribed and sworn to before me by John Kitts this 28th day of January 1863

Jos. Clement, Justice
of the peace Jeff Co Ky

Jefferson Co
Requisition on Missouri for Chas Rodgers & Jno W. Buckman
Req. Issd Jany 30. 1863
D. T. Bligh
